Package pieces

Class Piece

  • java.lang.Object
    • pieces.Piece
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    public abstract class Piece
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    A abstract class which defines a Piece. It is the general class used by all pieces in the game of chess.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      Piece​(java.lang.String symbol, java.lang.String name, boolean team)
      Piece 3 argument constructor sets all values as it should only be called by the constructor of the concrete classes which define the specific piece types

    • Constructor Detail

      • Piece

        public Piece​(java.lang.String symbol,
             java.lang.String name,
             boolean team)
        Piece 3 argument constructor sets all values as it should only be called by the constructor of the concrete classes which define the specific piece types
        Parameters:
        symbol - the symbol character which is displayed on the board
        name - the name of the piece type
        team - the team of the piece

    • Method Detail

      • validateMove

        public abstract boolean validateMove​(int[] firstPosition,
                                     int[] secondPosition)
        abstract method called when moving a piece. It defines when a move is valid or not.
        Parameters:
        firstPosition - this is the position the piece moves from
        secondPosition - this is the position the piece moves to
        Returns:
        if the move is valid it returns true. IF the move should not be able to be done, it returns false

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        method to get the name of the piece
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        name of the piece

      • getTeam

        public boolean getTeam()
        method returns the team of the piece
        Returns:
        true if it is owned by the upper team and false if owned by the lower team

      • getSymbol

        public java.lang.String getSymbol()
        method returns the symbol of the piece
        Returns:
        the symbol of the piece

      • movePiece

        public void movePiece​(int toX,
                      int toY,
                      int fromX,
                      int fromY)
        method moves the piece on the board. This covers removing killed pieces and clearing the position the piece comes from. This version takes 4 integers to define the 2 positions
        Parameters:
        toX - the x coordinate of the position the piece was moved from
        toY - the y coordinate of the position the piece was moved from
        fromX - the x coordinate of the position the piece was moved to
        fromY - the y coordinate of the position the piece was moved to

      • movePiece

        public void movePiece​(int[] to,
                      int[] from)
        method moves the piece on the board. This covers removing killed pieces and clearing the position the piece comes from. This version takes 2 integer arrays of length 2.
        Parameters:
        to - integer array of length 2 that defines the end position of the piece. the first position defines the x coordinate and the second position to the y coordinate
        from - integer array of length 2 that defines the start position of the piece. the first position defines the x coordinate and the second position to the y coordinate

      • isBlocked

        protected boolean isBlocked​(int[] last)
        method that checks if the position given can be the final position of a move it checks if the final position either has no piece on it or a piece of the opposite team.
        Parameters:
        last - integer array of length 2. The first position is the x coordinate and the second is the y coordinate of the final position of the move.
        Returns:
        true if the final position is not valid.
